page.title: 01HECKFIELD AND BRAMSHILL
page.content: The lanscape itself, open farmland and heath falling away to the Whitewater and Hant Rivers, has remained unchanged this century. There has beeb a very substantial increase in the volume of traffic mainly through the area to the growing industrial and commercial estates of Reading and Basingstoke. At the turn of the century the population of Heckfield was about 1000. The reduction in agricultural labour has brought the present population (adult) to about 250, housed in scattered hamlets. The three main houses, Heckfield Place (Georgian), Highfield House (Georgian) and Bramshill (Jacobean) have all become training centres for Racal, Digital Equipment and the Police respectively. The school has closed and besides a farm shop there are no retail facilites in the area.
